haibison.android.lockpattern.widget

Class LockPatternView

  • java.lang.Object
    • View
      • haibison.android.lockpattern.widget.LockPatternView

  • public class LockPatternView
extends View
    Displays and detects the user's unlock attempt, which is a drag of a finger across 9 regions of the screen.

    Is also capable of displaying a static pattern in "in progress", "wrong" or "correct" states.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  LockPatternView.Cell
      Represents a cell in the MATRIX_WIDTH x MATRIX_WIDTH matrix of the unlock pattern view.
      static class  LockPatternView.CellState 
      static class  LockPatternView.DisplayMode
      How to display the current pattern.
      static interface  LockPatternView.OnPatternListener
      The call back interface for detecting patterns entered by the user.

    • Field Summary

      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int MATRIX_SIZE
      The size of the pattern's matrix.
      static int MATRIX_WIDTH
      This is the width of the matrix (the number of dots per row and column).

    • Field Detail

      • MATRIX_WIDTH

        public static final int MATRIX_WIDTH
        This is the width of the matrix (the number of dots per row and column). Change this value to change the dimension of the pattern's matrix.
        Since:
        v2.7 beta
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        The size of the pattern's matrix.

        public LockPatternView.CellState[][] getCellStates()

      • isInStealthMode

        public boolean isInStealthMode()
        Returns:
        Whether the view is in stealth mode.

      • isTactileFeedbackEnabled

        public boolean isTactileFeedbackEnabled()
        Returns:
        Whether the view has tactile feedback enabled.

      • setInStealthMode

        public void setInStealthMode(boolean inStealthMode)
        Set whether the view is in stealth mode. If true, there will be no visible feedback as the user enters the pattern.
        Parameters:
        inStealthMode - Whether in stealth mode.

      • setTactileFeedbackEnabled

        public void setTactileFeedbackEnabled(boolean tactileFeedbackEnabled)
        Set whether the view will use tactile feedback. If true, there will be tactile feedback as the user enters the pattern.
        Parameters:
        tactileFeedbackEnabled - Whether tactile feedback is enabled

      • setOnPatternListener

        public void setOnPatternListener(LockPatternView.OnPatternListener onPatternListener)
        Set the call back for pattern detection.
        Parameters:
        onPatternListener - The call back.

      • getPattern

        public List<LockPatternView.Cell> getPattern()
        Retrieves current pattern.
        Returns:
        current displaying pattern. Note: This is an independent list with the view's pattern itself.

      • setPattern

        public void setPattern(LockPatternView.DisplayMode displayMode,
              List<LockPatternView.Cell> pattern)
        Set the pattern explicitely (rather than waiting for the user to input a pattern).
        Parameters:
        displayMode - How to display the pattern.
        pattern - The pattern.

      • getDisplayMode

        public LockPatternView.DisplayMode getDisplayMode()
        Gets display mode.
        Returns:
        display mode.

      • setDisplayMode

        public void setDisplayMode(LockPatternView.DisplayMode displayMode)
        Set the display mode of the current pattern. This can be useful, for instance, after detecting a pattern to tell this view whether change the in progress result to correct or wrong.
        Parameters:
        displayMode - The display mode.
